data.question: What is the chemical formula for the functionalized catecholate used in the synthesis of lithium salts?
Which lithium salt among the synthesized has shown additional thermal stability up to 280 8C?
data.answer: Li[B(DPC)F2] shows additional stability up to 280 8C.

data.question: What is the purpose of replacing the two phosphinato groups in FRION 1 with a chelating organophosphorus entity?
data.answer: To enhance the thermal stability of FRIONs.

data.question: What method was used to grow X-ray-quality crystals of Li[B(DPC)(oxalato)]?
data.answer: Vapor diffusion of hexanes into a THF solution.

data.question: What is the predicted greater oxidative stability of catechol borate anions attributed to?
data.answer: The presence of the two O = P(OMe)2 units driving the energy of the HOMO orbital down.

data.question: What is the significance of the high char yields produced upon combustion of the synthesized lithium salts?
data.answer: High char yields indicate reduced flammability and potential to slow fire growth in batteries by forming seals/caps between layers.

data.question: What was the yield percentage of Li[B(DPC)2] after drying?
How does the coordination polymer structure of Li[B(DPC)(oxalato)] in the solid state arise?
data.answer: Through the lithium ion being coordinated by a phosphoryl oxygen atom and a catecholate oxygen atom of one [B(DPC)-(oxalato)] anion, as well as by a phosphoryl oxygen atom and an oxalato oxygen atom of two other [B(DPC)-(oxalato)] anions.

data.question: Why might the addition of organophosphorus(V) compounds to LIB electrolyte solutions have deleterious effects?
data.answer: Because they may be susceptible to reduction at the low potentials of the anode, leading to capacity fading and disruption of a robust SEI formation.

data.question: What was the purpose of replacing the aqueous ammonium chloride quench with an aqueous hydrochloric acid quench in the preparation of H2-DPC?
data.answer: To lead to a significantly purer product suitable for subsequent use.

data.question: How does the structure of Li[P(DPC)3] compare to that of Li[B(DPC)(oxalato)] in terms of lithium ion coordination?
data.answer: Both structures have the lithium ion tetrahedrally coordinated, but in Li[P(DPC)3], each lithium ion is surrounded by four phosphoryl oxygen atoms from four different [P(DPC)3] anions, forming a network-type structure.

data.question: What is the role of the char layer produced during the combustion of organophosphorus-based flame-retardant compounds?
data.answer: The char layer acts as a thermal and gas barrier, reducing flammability.

data.question: True or False: Li[B(DPC)F2] was identified by multinuclear NMR spectroscopy.
True or False: The synthesis of H[P(DPC)3] resulted in a 100% yield.
data.answer: False, it resulted in a 97.1% yield.

data.question: True or False: The Li-O distances in Li[B(DPC)(oxalato)] are outside the range reported for other lithium oxalatoborate and lithium catecholatoborate salts.
data.answer: False, they are within the range.

data.question: True or False: The presence of O = P(OMe)2 units in catechol borate anions does not affect their oxidative stability.
data.answer: False, it drives the energy of the HOMO orbital down, predicting greater oxidative stability.

data.question: True or False: LiBOB has the highest char yield among the tested materials.
data.answer: False, Li[B(DPC)(Oxalato)] has the highest char yield.

data.question: True or False: The computational procedures used to predict the oxidative stability of the new FRIONs involved replacing the ethyl groups of DPC with methyl groups for simplicity.
